text:
Requirement from DV Chain (and likely from all other trading firms):

They can purchase a license, but they'll need on-chain credentials for their account at multiple custodians. For ex, DV Chain's account at Copper, DFNS, etc.

Hi team - <@U093Q4FPEJG> and I have been going back and forth on the customer addresses that will receive the rewards. The data file that he pulled from chain has a different counter-address for each party ID that is getting rewards (holder and minter); and we are not sure why: <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/13G9yg0Xm13ORHTa1BkvWVWkKWeIq6yaV/edit?gid=2094646024#gid=2094646024>

elements.text: and I have been going back and forth on the customer addresses that will receive the rewards. The data file that he pulled from chain has a different counter-address for each party ID that is getting rewards (holder and minter); and we are not sure why:

text: If we have a list that we are comfortable with in excel, Ferenc can replace the addresses in our database. Might still be worth figuring out where this oddity comes from to make sure we are not overlooking something. We could start with our excel tracker and have the customer confirm their address.

elements.text: If we have a list that we are comfortable with in excel, Ferenc can replace the addresses in our database. Might still be worth figuring out where this oddity comes from to make sure we are not overlooking something. We could start with our excel tracker and have the customer confirm their address.

<https://github.com/DLC-link/canton-billing-admin/blob/main/src/canton.rs#L623>

This is how it looks like in the chain data: <https://canton-billing-admin-bfaa44c93632.herokuapp.com/clients/launchnodes::1220409a9fcc5ff6422e29ab978c22c004dde33202546b4bcbde24b25b85353366c2>

text:
Hi <@U093Q4FPEJG> - sorry to throw another thing at you, but: Chris M from Proof (on the Accountability council) suggested we delete the zero-funded accounts. It'll help with optics. Some people think that we're earning from these.

Attached is a list of the zero-fundeds. Note that 4-5 of them have small remnant balances.

Questions:
1. Is it possible to delete the IDs with zero balance?
2. Is it possible to delete the ones with small balances? If not, no worries.

elements.text:
- sorry to throw another thing at you, but: Chris M from Proof (on the Accountability council) suggested we delete the zero-funded accounts. It'll help with optics. Some people think that we're earning from these.

Attached is a list of the zero-fundeds. Note that 4-5 of them have small remnant balances.

Questions:
Is it possible to delete the IDs with zero balance?
Is it possible to delete the ones with small balances? If not, no worries.

text: Hey, yes, I can work on that tomorrow. I think we can delete them, but since I did not try it yet I can't say it for sure. I'm like 80% that we can do it.

elements.text: Hey, yes, I can work on that tomorrow. I think we can delete them, but since I did not try it yet I can't say it for sure. I'm like 80% that we can do it.

text: Thanks! Tomorrow is great also. Not a firedrill

text:
It's not possible to delete parties from the validator, however, we can Disable them: <https://docs.digitalasset-staging.com/operate/3.3/howtos/operate/parties/parties.html#disable-a-party>

Not sure if this is enough for the optics..

elements.text: It's not possible to delete parties from the validator, however, we can Disable them:
Not sure if this is enough for the optics..

text: Disable is good enough!
Anything to give us CYA, to show that we're not actively billing on those

elements.text: Anything to give us CYA, to show that we're not actively billing on those

text: Later ofc, we'll want to enable some, to enable billing on them

elements.text: Later ofc, we'll want to enable some, to enable billing on them

text: On the other hand, I'm thinking, if we disable them and then later re-enable them, is it even worth it?

elements.text: On the other hand, I'm thinking, if we disable them and then later re-enable them, is it even worth it?

text: Maybe not worth it. I could just tell Chris sorry, we can't delete these, since Canton doesn't support delete

elements.text: Maybe not worth it. I could just tell Chris sorry, we can't delete these, since Canton doesn't support delete

text: But anyway, <@U093Q4FPEJG> I'll wait to hear back from you tomorrow

elements.text: I'll wait to hear back from you tomorrow

text: Yes, tomorrow I can validate this. Also figure out what disable actually means. Because if it gets those users out from the list, that can be the same.

elements.text: Yes, tomorrow I can validate this. Also figure out what disable actually means. Because if it gets those users out from the list, that can be the same.

text:
Summarize:

• We can't get those values from chain or CantonScan, because those parties have been created with the wrong values.
• If we can have these values from somewhere we can update them on-chain and in our system.
• What <@U05FZBDQ4RJ> sent can be good, but I'm not qualified to see which one goes to which local party ID. Also we have 121 companies at the moment with 242 parties (holder and minter).
• You can update those values in the admin UI by clicking on a client and click on the Update client.

elements.text: We can't get those values from chain or CantonScan, because those parties have been created with the wrong values.
If we can have these values from somewhere we can update them on-chain and in our system.
sent can be good, but I'm not qualified to see which one goes to which local party ID. Also we have 121 companies at the moment with 242 parties (holder and minter).
You can update those values in the admin UI by clicking on a client and click on the Update client.

text: Perfect, TY!
